author: Zach Allen
title: State College boys lacrosse scores 20 goals in win over Central Dauphin East - pennlive.com
text:
State College boys lacrosse routed Central Dauphin East 20-4 on Wednesday.
Trey Combs scored a team-high five goals in the win, while Cooper Brushwood had four goals. Brushwood and Combs also combined for seven assists.
Owen Kissinger set up State College’s attack with an 82% win percentage on face offs.

author: RNZ
title: MSD staff walk off the job due to 'unsafe' office | RNZ
text:
MSD staff walk off the job due to 'unsafe' office
More than a dozen Ministry of Social Development staff have walked off the job, refusing to return to what they say is an unsafe office with ''strong mould and sewerage smell'. Staff in the ministry's Thames office walked out of the office on Monday, leaving more than 10,000 clients without a face-to-face service. The office was supposed to be a temporary space, after MSD closed its main office in November 2023 due to damage. The Public Service Association has now issued MSD with a Provisional Improvement Notice under the Health and Safety at Work Act, which requires the employer to address concerns about health and safety. MSD has re-deployed staff to Paeroa which is 33km away and has upset community leaders. Thames Community Board chairman Adrian Catran spoke to Lisa Owen.

author: Fabian Campoverde
title: Vuelven las lluvias y se desatan problemas en las vías de Azuay
text:
Volvieron las lluvias y con ellas retornaron los deslizamientos, socavones y otros problemas a las vías de Azuay.
La evidencia más reciente se presentó en el kilómetro 54 de la vía Cuenca – Molleturo – El Empalme.
En este punto se presentó un socavón. Desde las autoridades se analiza el cierre de la vía Cuenca – Molleturo .
Mientras que en la vía Cuenca – Girón – Pasaje, a la altura del kilómetro 34, se presentó un grave deslizamiento desde la tarde del miércoles 1 de enero de 2025.
Hasta este jueves 2 de enero, la circulación vehicular por este tramo es pacial. Se recomienda conducir con precaución.
Vía El Descanso Al otro lado, enla vía que conduce a los cantones orientales de Azuay, también se reportaron emergencias viales.
Desde la Prefectura de Azuay se informó que hasta el sector El Descanso – Lumagpamba se remitió maquinaria para afrontar un deslizamiento de tierra provocado por las lluvias.
Este trabajo se ejecutó de manera conjunta con maquinaria del Ministerio de Transporte y Obras Públicas.
San Fernando Otro hecho se registró en la vía al cantón San Fernando, la tarde del 1 de enero.
En el sector de Norambote, se presentó una emergencia vial con material sobre la calzada.
Una cuadrilla de la Prefectura realizó la limpieza de material de ambos carriles para habilitar la circulación vehicular.
Todos estos inconvenientes se presentan debido a la presencia de lluvias registradas los días recientes. (I)
Más noticias:
Se analiza el cierre de la vía Cuenca – Molleturo

organizations.name: Ministerio de Transporte y Obras Públicas

author: Chrystal Blair
title: MI empowers disadvantaged communities for clean energy / Public News Service
text: The effects of climate change often hit Michigan's most vulnerable communities hardest, prompting state environmental organizations to take action. The Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes and Energy has launched the " Michigan Justice40 Accelerator " program in partnership with Elevate and the Michigan Environmental Justice Coalition. Under the initiative, 25 nonprofit organizations in underserved areas across the state will apply to receive funding and technical support to access federal money for clean-energy projects. Regina Strong, Michigan's environmental justice public advocate, explained what the groups will accomplish over a 12-month period. "Build capacity and learn the ins and outs of ways to apply for federal and state money, and all the things they need to hopefully address the challenges in the communities where they exist," Strong outlined. Strong noted communities interested in assistance need to apply by Aug. 1. Organizations must present an idea for addressing climate change in their community, which could include projects related to resilient infrastructure, clean energy and energy efficiency. Frontline communities in the climate change battle often include people of color, Indigenous groups, and low-income residents. Strong explained funding through the new program also empowers nonprofit organizations and those working toward nonprofit status, to lead efforts in tackling environmental disparities. "They often are less able to rebound when we have our heavy storms and rain -- there's flooding, or there's an emergency with air," Strong observed. "Oftentimes, these are communities that are already impacted by other challenges." Strong added parallel to the new program, The Office of Environmental Justice, Public Advocate has a $20 million grant opportunity available for the same communities. The deadline to apply for funding is July 15.
